Name: Ramesh
Title: A nice colourful and green environment for family and children.
Review: It is a well maintained flawless park with all colour flowers blooming in glory and very soothing and stress busting.

Name: vamsi
Title: Best park for winters
Review: Good place for outing in DELHI winters. Bonus is well maintained Flora and lots of Rose flowers. Hope the parking is sorted well but itâ€™s available. Recommended to take all picnic things to have full fun.

Name: Tarique S
Title: Delhi's just another green lungs
Review: Nehru Park is a fairly large green area in Delhi. Good place for Joggers and Yoga enthusiasts. A pretty decent playground for kids and youngsters. It also turns out to be a good place for picnic during winters. Well maintained flowerbeds, artificial fountains and mature trees makes it a pleasant place for relaxing.Important Info:1. Free Parking is available outside the park.2. Hawkers selling ice creams, chips, cold drinks etc can be found outside the park.3. Weekends are comparatively more crowded.4. Public Convenience available inside the park

Name: Sonya Deep kaur
Title: Good place for walking, jogging and running.
Review: If you are in Delhi and looking for a place to relax, walk, jog or even run with a little less feeling of being polluted then perhaps nehru park might bring a smile to your face. The park is clean and green! You can even get a few miles if exercise in! This place in around the embassy area so home to a lot of expats as well. There is an open air strength training gym which seems to be guarded by the four legged making sure you loose those extra pounds ðŸ˜Š

Name: Renu2
Title: Nehru Park
Review: I had been to Nehru Park as a child on school picnics but after that it just became  place that one passed by but never entered. A few days back a few friends decided to visit the park and we had so much fun. It is one of the few places where you can get away from the hustle and bustle of Delhi.  It has something for everyone. There is a track to run on. There are lovely plants, trees, flowers, rockeries and undulating lawns. There are benches to sit on. We also saw vendors selling tea and coffee inside the park. The park covers a large area and therefore never feels crowded even when there are multiple school groups that are there on picnics. I recommend this park highly. It really will rejuvenate the jaded and tired urban dweller in you.

Name: TheCreatist
Title: Very well maintained
Review: Its a beautiful, perfect green oasis in the middle of the hustle bustle of Delhi. Located in Chanakyapuri, its a great place to come with your family or friends. Kids will love it. So will health enthusiasts. Good place for a picnic.

Name: Madhulika L
Title: Something for everyone
Review: This vast park stretches all along one side of the diplomatic enclave in Chanakyapuri, and is one of the biggest landscaped parks in Delhi. There are several gates scattered along both sides of the park, so you can enter (some gates have designated free parking inside, others do not) wherever you wish. Entry is free. Inside, the space is a mix of areas: there is a jogging track, lots of walking paths, wide lawns which are dotted with picnickers during good weather, groves of trees, and more â€˜wildernessâ€™-like sections, where the tree cover is more dense. There are hillocks, some with statuary or installation art, others with easy climbing walls for children. There are benches scattered around here and there, and ice cream carts parked near the gates. The best thing about Nehru Park is that because itâ€™s so huge, a lot of activities can be held simultaneously without people getting in each otherâ€™s way. The last time we visited, we wandered through only about a quarter of the park, and came across two musical groups rehearsing, one dance group practicing, and several people picnickingâ€”as well as a cricket match in progress near a rope bridge which spans one wide ditch. None of these people were even within sight of each other; itâ€™s a great place, therefore, to go for a large picnicâ€”you arenâ€™t likely to have trouble finding space!The park also hosts some interesting concerts, food festivals, and other events during the autumn and winter, which mostly command an entrance fee for the event itself. One last tip: if youâ€™re a tree lover, do take the time to visit Nehru Park. It has some stunning trees, including some magnificent silk cottons, an unusually robust stand of chir pines (which actually bear cones), some beautiful groves of Bismarck palms, red cassias, and more. For a good cross-section of Delhiâ€™s most representative trees, Nehru Park deserves a mention alongside Sunder Nursery and Lodhi Gardens.

Name: Shobha
Title: Had fun
Review: The garden is beautiful and is clean . One can visit with family and friends . I came here with my husband and kids . We visited here in evening .

Name: Vibhu
Title: Best maintained park in Delhi
Review: Nehru Park is nestled in the midst of Embassies in the VIP area of Chanakyapuri in Delhi. One of the best-maintained parks in the city, it boasts of varied flora and attracts people of all ages. It's best suited for morning/evening runs or walks (have unpaved and paved tracks for both), yoga sessions, family and children's outings. It has ample parking space and a pictursque lake as well with ducks and some other animals.

Name: SangeetaAnand
Title: Nehru Park
Review: This huge expanse doubles up as a picnic spot, exercise track, walk trail & generally a place to get the kids. Its great during the day in winters and evenings in the summer.There's parking for convenience and lots to explore given its acreage. It's a lung of the city. Very well maintained it's also popular for events.

Name: Sriram_064
Title: The best maintained large park in Delhi
Review: The park is very well maintained as was the case in the past. The maintenance staff have added new varieties of flowers and have enhanced the colours all across the park. It is one of the best places for families to visit in the mornings, evenings and during the weekends. There is a decent jogging track which can be improved. The park is not only very spacious, but it also has water bodies and fountains. It is an excellent place for summer evenings. A must visit for any tourist to Delhi. There is no entry fee and there is ample car parking space. Kids will love the place for sure.

Name: Kanchan S
Title: Well maintained garden
Review: This is huge and well maintained park. We spend two to three hours there. This is the best park for family picnic in winters. But in summer season its better to aboid it. We enjoyed a lot.

Name: Smitpoo
Title: Nicely maintained Park!!
Review: Located in cenre of the city.Visited this place for a picnic.Its a awesome place for small outing with family and friends.as its a huge park ,i am sure everyone will enjoy including a pet(as its a pet freindly place).Parking is available outside the park.Really wish all the parks in delhi were mainteined in the same way.Lots of waste bins are also placed inside the park for the disposal of garbage.

Name: seeker_here
Title: Green in Delhi
Review: Nehru Park, near the diplomatic enclave of Chanakyapuri, is one of the few green spaces  in the city. It is a great place to soak in nature.

Name: gauth333
Title: Huge and well maintained
Review: Good place to plan a family picnic on a weekend during the winters. The place is nicely maintained with some water bodies. It's a good place to take a walk if you are staying nearby. There is ample parking space around the park. The authorities do not allow people playing cricket or football on the lawns. There are descent washrooms and drinking water facilities in this park.

Name: Global31010113190
Title: Good experience
Review: I gone there last month.... This place is superb suburb......this place is enjoying wit friends and family

Name: Ravi
Title: A very nice and cheerful place
Review: Good to visit in evening. The place is  crowded on weekends eveningAdvisable for family and picnic events

Name: Ashish S
Title: Amazing Park for Running
Review: It's one of the Best Park visited by me in INDIA. Very nicely maintained by NDMC. The wash rooms are very neat and clean. Parking facility is available which is free of cost. This is an amazing place to go for your early morning run.

Name: PushExplore
Title: Nice Winter Stroll
Review: Visit to the Nehru Park was nice on a crisp Sunday morning. We were actually headed to someone's house while we stopped by to have a quick stroll in this lovely park. Though there are several rough / brown patches the flowers were in bloom.

Name: 9708372852a
Title: Early morning walking in Nehru Park
Review: In the morning the I had walked in the park. It was a pleasant feeling. Smell of rose made is more plesant. Lovely morning walk.

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: Walkers Paradise
Review: A large number of morning and evening walkers go there and seen discussing day to day politics and social issues . You get good snacks also .Governor Amolak Rattan Kohli

Name: darshan c
Title: beautiful park
Review: there is a jogging track, they organize events like Jazz festival, Food festival etc. the park is very well maintained and one can visit with family and friends, all in all a great picnic spot or a place to jog or just laze around

Name: nik_0107
Title: Pleasant
Review: Peaceful, neat and well maintined park, it has a well thought landscape, a open gym and jogging track.

Name: TILAKDASS
Title: A great park for all !!!
Review: This is one of the best parks right in the middle of New Delhi. It is a very very big park & no matter how many people are there in the park, it is such a big park it seems like you have the whole park to yourself. It is a great park to have picnics with the family, walking, jogging, etc. A great park for relaxing for everyone, a must visit !

Name: mehtarakeshkumar56
Title: go green
Review: the park is situated in the lush green area of the diplomatic enclave . it has a track of 3 km for walk and jog .

Name: prkota05
Title: Nehru park
Review: This is community park having trail for jogging has beautiful collection of flowers and trees so enjoy this calm place of natural beauty

Name: Catherine Louise
Title: So beautiful in March
Review: Early March is a great month for Delhi, and parks like Nehru park help you to enjoy it to the max! Itâ€™s clean, the flowers are stunning, there are even some gazebos available which we used to have a picnic with friends.

Name: JMGeneva
Title: Peaceful and very pleasant
Review: This large park offers a nice network of paths among many flowers. It is peaceful and very well maintained (yes it is clean, s surprising as it sounds!).  Nothing really special there except for the nice statute of Lenin and no real need to make a detour but if you happen to be in the area it is well worth strolling through.

Name: som
Title: Park to Relax
Review: A nice community Park for jogger & kids. The landscaping is very thoughtfull. It has two jogger's track as well as lot of open air gymnasium equipment. All are free to use for anybody & everybody. A bunch of Ducks are kept here. In evenings, Ducks are allowed to roam free in open. Children love to play with them. The only constraint is parking of your personal vehicles. You may have to park @200-500 mtr far, near to nearby gated communities.

Name: travelerraghu
Title: A good neat park
Review: This park is named after Jawaharlal Nehru who was the first prime minister of India. The whole park is green and is well maintained. The perk is neat and tidy.

Name: AnneML63
Title: South Delhi's Green Spot
Review: Visiting Nehru Park after a long lapse was a pleasant surprise. The park remains rather well maintained (although there were some mini trenches work, not always properly signalled so beware!). There are some open air fitness equipment in different spots. Another novelty for me where the water boots (although unoccupied at the time of visit). The park is certainly best visited when there are no picnic crowds, which means about every day of the week, except Sundays. There could be some further improvements such as signalling to people where they are in the park (where is the nearest exit of water booth or toilet). Unfortunately, many visitors leave a garbage trail after a picnic or a stroll (wrappers, bottles etc) while there are sufficient garbage bins around. There were also a few stray dogs around, but they seemed tamed and more interested in a nap than disturbing walkers or joggers. Walking with my daughter, we attracted some glare from the few other passers-by and the inevitable "where are you from" question from local people. So I would recommend women to walk in pair or more or go at time of higher affluence to be on the safe side. Compared to Lodhi (or Lodi) park, there is little outside the landscaping of the park to entertain the visitor (outside events like music concerts at some time of the year). Anyway, a safe haven in congested and polluted Delhi.

Name: Kumar S
Title: Nehru Park
Review: Another place named after Nehru dynasty, nothing special to visit. Park is big and clean but nothing special.

Name: vikas9743
Title: Nice garden for a evening or morning walk
Review: Located prominently in Chanakya Puri, this a ice park where one can do daily exercise and jog in the fresh and peaceful atmosphere...

Name: Sangeeta Bahuguna
Title: Great place for Walk or Picnics !!!
Review: Very well maintained and well manicured at the prime location, good for a leisurely walk or a family picnic

Name: Rahul K
Title: Must visit to relax and cherish the beauty of flowers
Review: Never expected such a beautiful park near Nehru Place. I went with no expectation but simply amazed to see the maintenance and beauty of the park. It got big space to roam around and good collection of flower to shoot at sight! Take your time off from hectic metro life and just - Sit back and relax.Extra Note: If you find it less crowded then bring your paper and pen if you are a creative writer.

Name: malvika b
Title: good park
Review: its a nice big park..excellent for picnics and morning walk..full of greenery..good place to relax...

Name: tnnagpal
Title: Early Morning Walk
Review: Ideal for an early morning walk in the summer. One sees loads of flowers, well-kept gardens. Availability of drinking water and clean toilets. Decent gentry.

Name: tripsmaker
Title: A Park trail in Delhi
Review: It is large green Park located in Chanakyapuri diplomatic enclave of New Delhi. The park is named after Jawaharlal Nehru, the first prime minister of India. It has old Lord Shiva temple, along with a cafe and a big statue of Comrade V.I. Lenin. Every day morning and evening ragas, yoga classes and different types of activities are staged. Leftist parties stationed at Delhi, commemorate the birth anniversary of Lenin during the month of April. It's a place of tourist interest, in Delhi.

Name: Nikhil P
Title: Lush greenery
Review: Located in the Posh area of Chanakyapuri, itâ€™s a huge park, quite popular for cultural and musical events. Its being managed by New Delhi Municipal Corporation (or NDMC) . Its one of the few places in concrete jungle of Delhi where you will find lush greenery.  People doing jogging, yoga, etc is a common scene over here.

Name: Priyadarshi_Sing
Title: Nive place for morninv and evening walks, well maintained
Review: This place is well maintained and perfect for a morning and a evening walk or jog. Its big too with places to sit also if you are tired.

Name: BuBu S
Title: Pleasant and relaxation
Review: Nice park for morning jog or walk. I was alone and feel pretty safe there. If you stayed nearby, recommend waking up early and jog around. Delhi, early morning on weekend, is very pleasant.

Name: 1Rakesh
Title: World largest food festival
Review: Amazing food festival in Nehru park . There were many many stalls in the park . Everything was good in the food . But I like very much Crodo the juicery stall . My favorite juices #Rose_berried_ treasure.

Name: rabhat2013
Title: A good refreshing place
Review: The Park is very good for long walk,picnic and enjoying sun during winter day.Place has good walking & jogging tracks. Its full of greenery and full of activity on week ends.One can enjoy morning walk any day.

Name: Kapil Vijan
Title: One of the better maintained parks in Delhi
Review: May be it's the VVIP surroundings, that's why this is one of the better maintained parks in Delhi. There are lovely flowers, green lawns and beautiful trees.

Name: Mohammad I
Title: Well Maintained Park
Review: Beautifull garden with large number of variety of flowering plants. Green grass all over. Evening time best.

Name: 1969atul
Title: PLEASANT
Review: The park located in diplomatic area, is a VIP park, hence the facilities and maintenance is upto the mark.Families can enjoy whole day here, with lot of activities to do.

Name: rsksquare
Title: Lovely lawns, uncrowded
Review: The place is ideal for spending time simply lazing on a winter morning. It is spacious enough that one is unlikely to bump into or even see too many people.

Name: AVEMEADOWS Vagamon
Title: Location is good
Review: It is very big and located strategically. You can have long walks and children can play and have a picinic in the garden

Name: Pratyush_Dixit
Title: Nothing to see
Review: This is a good park for joggers and people into fitness. Apart from this there is nothing exceptional about this park.

Name: Ravs2394
Title: Large park
Review: Nehru Park is surely one of the biggest park in Delhi in terms of area covered. Situated in Diplomatic Enclave (Near all the embassies, PM House & Shanti Path), the location is serene & very peaceful. Looking forward to give it a try with kids.

Name: Amit_Mittal
Title: 2715 meters
Review: 2715 meters is the length of jogging track on the periphery of the park. One of the better maintained parks of the Delhi city. It is situated in diplomatic area of the city and supports the life with its lush green environment. There is a concrete jogging track along with a soft mud one. NDMC the agency managing the park has installed open gymnasium in the park, there is separate area for yoga and few man made water bodies. The place is good to visit for morning and evening walk as well as any time of the day. There are adequate public facilities inside the park, the parking is free of charge.

Name: Shashank
Title: Decent
Review: Requires some maintenance and upkeep by the authorities, but serves well as a spot to relax and wind down. Not too crowded either.

Name: Dishaa S
Title: green and serene
Review: the huge expanse of lush greenery and flowers is very popular with the locals here, joggers in the morning and evening and families and couples during the day. it is also a venue for some amazing musicals gigs in the town.

Name: AviMF
Title: Quiet place for Karate, sitting around or jogging
Review: Nehru Park has a quiet and soothing atmosphere if you want to just take a evening stroll, practice some karate or go for a jog.

Name: ashishtravelouge
Title: Nice place with jogging track
Review: Nice big fairly well maintained garden .....jogging track is also very good ... Be aware of ants if you are planing to sit in grass

Name: lekhram m
Title: public park with good amenities but nothing attactive
Review: Good for morning/evening walksgood running track and exercise facilities nice ambiance but after morning hours and before evening hours you will find more workers there.

Name: Ram Narayan S
Title: best jogging place
Review: nehru place, located in the diplomatic area, has nice jogging track with length of 2.7km. its a lively place to be around in delhi

Name: Douglas B
Title: Large park but not the most interesting
Review: Nehru Park struck me as a park more for those living in the area than for tourists. It is a large park with lawns, walking/jogging paths and a small hill and plenty of trees. However, it has no historical buildings within the park like at Lodhi Gardens which makes it a little less interesting. Also the water features were not working and had essentially no water despite being about 1 week after heavy rains - this may reduce mosquitoes but also means no waterbirds. I may return to Nehru Park but would want to combine it with visiting more in the area - otherwise I would go to Lodhi Gardens.

Name: madhav n
Title: minimal effort
Review: Delhi is being ruined by skyscrapers. Had town planners remained faithful to an earlier vow to refuse permits for such monsters,the city would have been far more livable. Businesses would have sprouted in satellite cities around the capital, and Delhi would have remained a charming place rather than the traffic and infrastructural hell it presently is. Nehru park is still untouched,perhaps because it is adjacent to the diplomatic area and would exite global censure if overrun by buildings,for example the way  land intended for the airport has been by the developer. Upkeep is minimal but even this little is enough for a great spot to take a walk in the evenings or to picnic on winter afternoons

Name: Sunil K
Title: One of the largest park of New Delhi
Review: Here you will find lush green park and garden.its avery large garden and one can go anytime there.Here normally people come for walking and jogging.

Name: GauravJain112
Title: Nice and refreshing
Review: Nehru Park, Delhi, is a large park situated in the Chanakyapuri. It is quite famous and popular with all age peoples. Jogging track is excellent. Lot of greenery and trees are there. Park is very well maintained. You will see lots of birds and squirrels.

Name: Singh56
Title: Nice park in New Delhi
Review: I visited this park with my cousin brother's for a hang out party.The park is very big and suitable for a picnic place.The park was very clean and well maintained.The park has many trees.So,You will be refreshed.

Name: shalinikh
Title: beautiful and peaceful
Review: Dont tell me you havent been there yet even once ! the picnics, games or open air shows... something... pls go now

Name: nikhil0210
Title: A very nice green park
Review: Walk around, sit calmly, enjoy picnic and play here in this very well kept park in the most important area of capital holding all international embassies.

Name: lotusdiamond
Title: PARK- full of activities
Review: Situated in the heart of Chanakyapuri Diplomatic enclave. Park is very well maintained and very big. Good for children and family picnics. Jogging track is superb. Plenty of benches takes care of seniors, who relax after walking and jogging. Regularly cultural and food festivals are organised. In winters you must visit to enjoy the beauty of flowers.

Name: roydinesh
Title: Renowned Park
Review: This is one of the best parks in New Delhi area, and also closest to the diplomatic enclave, Ashoka hotel and senior govt officers colony in Chanakyapuri.It is quite popular with both the young and old people.College boys and girls, young couples frequent this park in search of privacy , for gossip and while away time in relatively quiet surroundings.Morning and evening walkers descend here in large numbers.Jogging track is exceptionally good.Plenty of benches takes care of the seniors,who like to relax after walking.At times cultural activities take place on Sunday morning.A good place for Yogic exercises .In winter, season flowers enhance the beauty and ambience of the park.One has to depend on one's own vehicles or taxis to reach this park.

Name: SipaiAfzal
Title: Nice
Review: Nehru Park, Delhi, is a large park situated in the Chanakyapuri Diplomatic Enclave of New Delhi. Named after India's first Prime Minister, Jawaharlal Nehru.

Name: ST_INDIA
Title: Good Park in the heart of Delhi
Review: Its a Good Park in the heart of Delhi and is very well maintained by the authorities. The park is full of trees and flowers. Good for family picnic for sure.

Name: Coolbuddy83
Title: Nice
Review: One of the very nice option in Delhi for picnic. Lot of greenery around here. One can walk, relax, jog here.

Name: Meenakshi A
Title: for the love of outdoors
Review: delhi winters and Nehru park is amust .with the delhi tourism organising food festivals and music a family outing is a good idea

Name: bindu2016
Title: Lush green
Review: this is situated in chankyapuri.  you can go out picnic in winters.  very neat and clean and lush green.

Name: ash0kah00ja
Title: You can breath fresh air
Review: This park is named after our first prime minister and has a very large area. It is well maintained . Visitors can have a very healthy walk and exercise during morning and evenings. Many times social/cultural functions are also held in this park. It is very well located and one can reach easily.

Name: shivshankarsingh
Title: Beautiful Park in Chanakyapuri.
Review: Nehru Park is like Central Park ,New York. Situated in diplomatic area ,near Hotel Ashok Nehru Park has variety of flora including flowering trees and seasonal plants. Ideal for morning walks. Cultural events are held regularly. It has convenient parking for vehicles too.

Name: Deepti_Gupta
Title: A place to take a morning walk among plethora of flowers and beautiful surroundings
Review: It's nearby Sarojini Nagar.. the park is huge and has valleys, and never ending rows of flowers. An ideal place to take a walk on mornings and spend some quality time with nature...

Name: VivekTheTraveler
Title: Nehru Park
Review: This is a very big park in the middle of the place called Chanakya Puri and is located next to Ashoka Hotel and very near to the Prime Minister's House. it a very cool and calm place and has swings for children as well.

Name: Sneha1301
Title: Nice Park for Delhites
Review: This park is located in Chanakyapuri and is quiet a nice place to visit especially in Feb and March when the flowering plants blossom.  The park has a dedicated walking track There is also an open air gym in the park which one can use to exercise. The park is also the venue for lot of cultural shows and food festivals.

Name: HarryHSR
Title: Very well maintained
Review: this park is located in central Delhi and very close to the Embassy area ... good place to go for a stroll/ jog, the park s very well maintained, free parking, some gym equip also available for the fitness freaks ....

Name: Rajivglobaltraveller
Title: Nehru Park ---Chanakyapuri
Review: It is located near Ashoka Hotel in Chanakyapuri. It is a beautiful green picnic spot. This place is diplomatic.

Name: MamaBearOz
Title: Delhi's Lungs
Review: I've just spent a couple of weeks visiting with friends in New Delhi and it's their habit to regularly walk in Nehru Park. Given the state of the roads, the congested traffic, and the pollution, a walk in a park is a must-do activity for health and well-being. Nehru Park is a great venue for walking, jogging, doing yoga, meditating, or picnicking. A couple of rounds of the park is about a 5km walk and early on a Sunday morning there are few people to get in the way. The gardens are lovely, with ample pathways, lots of trees, a zillion squirrels, and beautifully laid out flower beds that are well maintained. There are also plenty of water features in the gardens but each of these was dry, which was a real shame. This might be because water is in short supply, or a seasonal thing, I don't know, but empty ponds look very sad. There is also plenty of rubbish lying around, despite there being plenty of bins. Littering is a shameful Indian habit that is overlooked by most people (even though the same people complain about the rubbish!). So, if you visit, take your rubbish home and pick up someone else's, too. The major lack is toilets. There are toilets and one set is clean, but the other set is not so well maintained. The good set has just one cubicle for women. Given the number of people who use the park, this is a serious lack. It contributed to our decision to go early in the mornings.

Name: Nathalie7077
Title: Delightful park in the city
Review: A quiet place for reprieve in the city, this park has something for everyone--running trails, gazebos, benches, picnic grass areas, and exercise equipment.  Located off Shantipath in Chanakdapur near the diplomatic enclave, this location has plenty of space for groups and families alike.  While the grounds are well maintained, the fountains and pools have clearly seen better days, and are a bit run down or empty.  If the sight of dozens of couples noodling around the park and on benches doesn't bother you, bring the kids for a walk or play on the grass.  One thing to be aware of is that "Hijras" (transvestites) like to visit the park and badger guests for money.

Name: RGS
Title: Beautiful atmosphere
Review: This place has beautiful gardens and serene peace. Beautiful flowers add to the beauty of this place. Do visit this place to relax and unwind.

Name: traveller09Delhi
Title: Place for peace
Review: an ideal place for walk and also to enjoy the park and surroundings. This is very close to Ashoka Hotel and maintained well.

Name: Nishit7
Title: Lots of festivals
Review: Nehru Park is a popular destination in the winter for music festivals, concerts, food festivals, and the like, so keep an eye out for them.

Name: musafir_nonstop
Title: Clean and well maintained..
Review: It is situated on the main Panchsheel road.. It has a good collection of flowers and trees.. There are little mounds and rocks aslo with the inscriptions.. Since this park is well maintained it serves as a perfect place for picnics.. In the morning and evening the park get very crowded with children enjoying the surroundings and the adults walking.. It also includes a musical fountain also..

Name: Ronald_jelle
Title: I went here for a walk, but not what I had hoped....
Review: I went to Nehru park, it's near the Embassy area, so the air here is relatively clean and so is the park... but.... It doesn't have much, there are trees, there are some flowers, but not much and well I couldn't find anything for my young children to play with (and neither could our taxi driver). We walked for about 25 minutes through the park and yes it is green... but it is nothing like Lodi gardens... Lodi really has more to offer, the monuments, there is actually water in the pond and well here the park seemed mostly filled with Joggers, lovebirds and also people that were bothering me (wanted something from me, which never happened in Lodi gardens). Added to that Lodi also has the restaurant, something I couldn't find here either, so for me it was the second and last time. For those who don't have to spent months in Delhi and just want to go to a nice park, go to Lodi... It really has more to offer and is much nicer!. Nehru park is green and has some color... but it just isn't as nice... an average park.

Name: TravellerPetals
Title: A Delight to go there anytime
Review: The park is neat and clean (at least whenever I have been there) and the crowd is matured. People are usually having picnic's or families coming together in large numbers as there is little decency left in this park - unlike the vulgar behavior in other Delhi parks.

Name: Sarah_Kaushik
Title: A great park!
Review: Its a really nice park for strolls. This happens to be one of the very few parks where events like Palette Fest and Jazz Fest take place.

Name: wpg01
Title: Named after an idiot.
Review: Other than its terrible name (after the person who helped create the dirty corrupt mess all around), this is a large and pleasant park. Worth a stroll if you're in the area.

Name: anandsrivastava
Title: Lovely winter picnic
Review: After a few foggy days, it was a bright and sunny winter day. We went to Nehru park for a picnic and had a wonderful time.The  park  is large and well maintained.      Just a few suggestions: there was a large group  playing Tambola for which they were using a megaphone. Megaphones should not be allowed.Disturbs the peace and serenity.      Considering that one has to pay Rs. 5/ for the use of toilet, it should be odour-free.                                                     A.K. Srivastava

Name: IMumbaitraveller
Title: Winter picnic
Review: A wonderful place for picnic in winters.. Enjoy the sun and forget the worldYou can play some group games too.For those staying close by it has a jogging track and an open gym.

Name: Delhi1107
Title: Very nice park
Review: Its a beautiful green spot to spend a good day with family or friends, has a nice rose plants which were Pandit Nehru's favourite flower....has a lot of spots around it as well..

Name: AlpShi
Title: So much green space - who knew
Review: A tourist visiting Delhi might completely miss this lovely garden, but if you have a few hrs to relax this is the place to go.There are a variety of outdoor exercise equipments (does not need electricity) for everyone to use. While you exercise, enjoy the flowers in the garden in front. There is a lot of green space for kids to play and a walking/running track.I would certainly recommend this as a change from all the historical monuments, just to experience what Delhi has to offer in the middle of all the traffic.

Name: Sandeep S
Title: Lovely Garden
Review: You can see people here from early in the morning.. In the morning you can see them exercising or running.. During the day having picnics and evenings are also music in the park. Lovely atmosphere .. Lovely flowers and Landscaping..

Name: pcrants
Title: Great place
Review: Whether early morning walks or reunions..it is a hub where people meet..watch nature ..and watch the world go by.A convenient landmark and vest during winters with all the blooms.The usp during winters being many foodfests which is a must to visit. The most popular of them all is palate food fest..which is starting on 27th nov till30th.. The venue is perfect and now a venue for many other fests during the better months of delhi..few workshops..congregations via different forums..This place works..Even if u skip it as a sightseeing venue..don't miss the festivals..keep abreast of it and go if u here during winters .

Name: Felicia D
Title: Relaxing and quiet
Review: The morning we were there, some young teens were practicing karate (or Tae Kwon Do?) Some people were sitting on the ground and meditating.  It was very quiet and relaxing there.  You won't spend a tremendous amount of time, but it's a nice way to break up the day from the loudness in Delhi.

Name: VINCENTNEWDELHI
Title: best in winters
Review: The place is mostly used by foreign diplomats staying in the vicinity. well kept and maintained its an ideal place for family picnic and reunions. Sunday is very crowded and best timing are nov- feb in afternoon

Name: Talhabari
Title: Beautiful, Massive and well maintained park
Review: Personally this is my favorite park in Delhi. I visit with my family very often and its always a calm and soothing experience. The trees, the grass, the flowers etc. is very refreshing. It also has modern exercise equipments to workout for all age group. There is enough of parking space and multiple entrances.

Name: Manojitsingh
Title: Right time and Right place for Winter and outdoor activity.
Review: Centrally located , great place for family to visit. If you are a health freak check out its jogger track or the well kept garden garden for yoga. You can also visit the outdoor gym installed at various section of the park. With clean washroom including paid .. If you are in hunger mode check out its9 cafe or Bikanerwala or the famous Tibetian fare at Yashwant palace.. With Winters setting in ..... right time to visit.

Name: Unni2006
Title: Nehru Park
Review: The park is a good venue for picnics and jogging and one can beat the heat during the extreme summer days . It is also good for spending the winter days under sun. It is situated near Ashoka hotel , Chanakyapuri and one needs transport access to reach the place. Good well maintained place.

Name: Rajatm123
Title: Excellent for a run anytime of the day
Review: Love going for  run in the park, the running track is a little over 2 km and it is a dirt track. Also, sometimes running around the park outside. The park is very well maintained and clean.
